Clarity.description: Clear sentences that effectively communicate the intended message can receive a higher score. Points can be deducted for sentences that are unclear or difficult to understand.

Conciseness.description: Sentences that are concise and to the point can receive a higher score. Points can be deducted for sentences that are too wordy or contain unnecessary phrases.

Coherence.description: Sentences that are well-organized and flow logically can receive a higher score. Points can be deducted for sentences that are disorganized or lack coherence.

Variety.description: Sentences that have variety in structure and length can receive a higher score. Points can be deducted for sentences that are too repetitive or lack variety.

Correctness.description: Sentences that are grammatically correct and free of spelling errors can receive a higher score. Points can be deducted for sentences that contain errors in grammar or spelling.
